website_summaries.verdict: Quick installation and additional tips and instructions make Phoenix Cables an easy choice.
pros: Built-in thermostat provides worry-free heat regulation
Provided instructions are easy to follow
An e-book is also available for additional tips and instructions
Cable feels durable and built to last
Cable will turn on automatically when temperature reaches below 38 degrees and will turn off when it reaches 45 degrees
cons: Some images are misleading, the cable can not be wrapped around a pipe, it must be attached straight

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I run a small horse farm, my spigot froze, I was looking into the $200+ heated hoses, and that was just too much of an overkill. I searched for options to wrap up the spigot itself and came across this product. It keeps it Warm, and I haven't had any frozen pipes since. Simple solution and so much cheaper. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heat cable for whatever you use it for.
customer_reviews.text: This heat cable is great to keep your fresh water tank from freezing. Wrapped with heavy duty aluminum foil. Then fold the thermostat round button useing gorilla tape up and place the thermostat button up against the aluminum foil to monitor temp control automatically. Tape on bottom of holding tank using gorilla tape and spray insta-foam insulation to secure and Insulate bottom of tank,,secure insulation up to tank with nylon screen meshing and insta-foam. Works great,,just plug in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: MWMII

customer_reviews.title: Quality made product and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Tried to test the unit with ice cooling the black probe sensor. It was not enough to trigger the thermostat but wrapping the whole body of the sensor in ice pack did the trick. Seems more dependent on ambient air temperature than a specific contact point. I don't think this impacts the effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: The Gemini

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heating tape and it really helps my water pipes I live in the country and I had to really watch my water and this is helping me a lot thank you
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: American company with a product that works
customer_reviews.text: This product just works and I don't have to think about frozen pipes. The hardest part, though zero faults of the product, is the installation on existing pipes. Having to find AC power to connect to is a chore. But neither issue is related to the product. One probably should disconnect power after the last freeze, although the thermostat on the unit works to keep the unit off until needed. (Just don't like vampire current being consumed in my household for devices 'ready' to switch on.)
customer_reviews.author: D. B. Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Protects a water filter from freezing!
customer_reviews.text: I had a unique application where I needed to protect a Big Blue water filter from freezing. I posted a question and John at Phoenix quickly answered it and gave me his recommendations. I ordered a 6 ft heater and a roll of 1.9 inch aluminum tape. It only took 30 minutes to install and the water filter and copper inlet line from the ground is now protected. Thanks for your help!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gayleonthego

customer_reviews.title: Kept my pipes from freezing
customer_reviews.text: I have a breezeway between my house and garage - it is not heated. I use a small heater in there which worked until it got into the low double digits when my pipes froze. I put this heat tape on and insulated with cotton insulation -pipes have not frozen since here in upstate NY... easy to use, apply it re: directions and forget about it...

feature_bullets: No Wrapping Around Pipe Means Easy Install and Longer Coverage – Other heat tape for water pipes are HARD to wrap and offer LESS coverage. Our pipe wrap heat tape is powerful and easy enough to install in a straight line to keep your pipes from freezing. The indicator light on our heat cable for water pipes lets you know your pipe warmer is on and ready to take on the harshest seasons.

Save Thousands On Costly Plumbing Repairs – Don’t wait before it’s too late and get stuck paying thousands of dollars on unexpected repairs that could be avoided. Our high-grade pipe heater is tough and durable enough for rigid plastic and metal pipes up to 2. 5” (58mm) in diameter. Our trace cables have a built in heat tape thermostat so you’ll always stay prepared for the unexpected.

Our Heat Strip Saves Money On Energy and is Eco-Friendly – 120 Volt, 7 watts/ft. and only use 5 amps or less of electricity making our heat tapes for water pipes environmentally friendly for a low economical footprint. Save money with our electric heat cable by using less energy by powering the self regulating heat trace cable only when needed by automatically turning on below 38° F (3° C) and above 45° F (7 ° C).

Safety Tested Heated Pipe Wrap For All Seasons – When it comes to water pipe tape, compromise elsewhere for the safety of your home. Get peace of mind with our safety rated heat trace for pipes constructed with a continuous ground braid with a tough and durable polyurethane inner insulation and weather resistant PVC (high-low temperature) for outer protective jacket. Our heat tape with thermostat is approved for water filled plastic (including PEX) and metal pipes only.

UL Approved, CSA Certified – Our heat trace for pipes are made of superior industrial grade heat shrinkage tube for connection. This pipe warmer heating cable is considered to be the safest per industry standards. Heating tape set-up includes: water pipe heat tape, grounded plug, built-in automatic thermostat and easy to understand instructions. Our plumbing heat tape plug into a standard 120 VAC outlet.
